title: Missing Security Headers (Clickjacking Protection)
description: The application is missing critical security headers that prevent common web attacks. Specifically, the X-Frame-Options header is not set, which fails to prevent clickjacking attacks. Additionally, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, and Content-Security-Policy headers are also missing. These headers are essential for protecting against frame-based clickjacking attacks, MIME-type sniffing, and XSS attacks.
impact: Without X-Frame-Options: Attackers can embed the trading platform in an invisible iframe on a malicious website and trick users into clicking on hidden buttons or links (clickjacking attack), potentially causing unauthorized transactions or account modifications. Without CSP and X-XSS-Protection: Applications are more vulnerable to stored and reflected XSS attacks. Without X-Content-Type-Options: Browsers may interpret files as different MIME types than intended, enabling MIME-sniffing attacks.
evidence:
POC script execution confirmed all four critical security headers are missing from HTTP response:

Command: curl -i http://localhost:8080/dashboard

HTTP Response Headers Analysis:
- [笨余 X-Frame-Options: MISSING - Vulnerable to clickjacking attacks
- [笨余 Content-Security-Policy: MISSING - Vulnerable to XSS attacks
- [笨余 X-Content-Type-Options: MISSING - Vulnerable to MIME-type sniffing
- [笨余 X-XSS-Protection: MISSING - Reduced XSS protection in older browsers

The server is configured to return only basic headers (Date, Server, Content-Length, Location, Cache-Control, Pragma, Expires, Vary, Content-Type) without any security-related headers.
remediation:
1. Add X-Frame-Options: DENY header to prevent clickjacking (or use SAMEORIGIN if frame embedding is required for legitimate purposes)
2. Implement Content-Security-Policy header with strict directives to prevent XSS attacks (e.g., default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline')
3. Add X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff to prevent MIME-type sniffing attacks
4. Add X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block for enhanced XSS protection in older browsers
5. Configure these headers at the web server level (Apache, nginx) or application middleware level
6. Example Apache configuration in .htaccess or httpd.conf:
   ```
   Header always set X-Frame-Options "DENY"
   Header always set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
   Header always set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
   Header always set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'"
   ```
7. For nginx, add to server block:
   ```
   add_header X-Frame-Options "DENY" always;
   add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff" always;
   add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block" always;
   add_header Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'" always;
   ```
8. Test the configuration to ensure headers are correctly returned in all HTTP responses
references: OWASP A05:2021 - Security Misconfiguration; CWE-693 - Protection Mechanism Failure; OWASP Clickjacking Prevention Cheat Sheet; OWASP Content Security Policy; MDN Web Docs - X-Frame-Options
toolCallDescription: Document missing security headers vulnerability with confirmed POC demonstrating absence of X-Frame-Options, CSP, X-Content-Type-Options, and X-XSS-Protection headers
